com.skysql.java

Class MonAPI

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.skysql.java.MonAPI

  • public class MonAPI
extends java.lang.Object
    The interface to the SkySQL Manager API, a REST interface to the monitor database. This is the API that should be used to store all monitor observations and to retrieve system configuration information rather than access the SQLite monitoring database directly.
    Author:
    Mark Riddoch, Massimo Siani

    • Constructor Detail

      • MonAPI

        public MonAPI()
        Constructs the MonAPI instance. This consists of obtaining the information required to contact the API. This information is available via Java System Properties. Sets the buffering to true by default, and the key ID to 1.

      • MonAPI

        public MonAPI(int APIKeyID)
        Constructs the MonAPI instance. This consists of obtaining the information required to contact the API. This information is available via Java System Properties. Sets the buffering to true by default.
        Parameters:
        APIKeyID - the API key ID of the running component

      • MonAPI

        public MonAPI(boolean buffer,
      int APIKeyId)
        Constructs the MonAPI instance. This consists of obtaining the information required to contact the API. This information is available via Java System Properties.
        Parameters:
        buffer - true if buffer is active (default).
        APIKeyId - the API key ID of the running component. Default is 1.

    • Method Detail

      • MonitorValue

        public boolean MonitorValue(int systemID,
                   java.lang.String monitorKey,
                   java.lang.String value)
        Populate a monitor value for the system. Sends a POST request.
        Parameters:
        systemID - The ID of the System
        monitorKey - The key of the monitor itself
        value - The observed value
        Returns:
        True if the update was performed to the API

      • bulkMonitorValue

        public boolean bulkMonitorValue(java.lang.String apiRequest,

                       java.lang.String[] values)
        Bulk update API. POST request.
        Parameters:
        apiRequest - the request uri
        fields -
        values -
        Returns:
        True if the update was performed

      • updateValue

        public boolean updateValue(java.lang.String restRequest,
                  java.lang.String pName,
                  java.lang.String pValue)
        API call which requires to modify something. Sends a PUT request.
        Parameters:
        restRequest - the API URI
        pName - the name of the parameter
        pValue - the value of the parameter
        Returns:
        true on success, false otherwise

      • updateValue

        public java.lang.String updateValue(java.lang.String restRequest,
                           java.lang.String[] pName,
                           java.lang.String[] pValue)
        API call which requires to modify something. Sends a PUT request.
        Parameters:
        restRequest - the API URI
        pName - an array with the names of the parameters
        pValue - an array with the values of the parameters
        Returns:
        the Json from the API as is, or null if an error occurred.

      • getReturnedJson

        public java.lang.String getReturnedJson(java.lang.String restRequest,
                               java.lang.String[] pName,
                               java.lang.String[] pValue)
        Bounce the Json that comes from the API. Only for GET requests. This is a convenient call for getReturnedJson(restRequest, pName, pValue, null).
        Parameters:
        restRequest - the API URI
        pName - an array with the names of the parameters, can be null
        pValue - an array with the values of the parameters, can be null
        Returns:
        the Json from the API as is, or null if an error occurred.

      • getReturnedJson

        public java.lang.String getReturnedJson(java.lang.String restRequest,
                               java.lang.String[] pName,
                               java.lang.String[] pValue,
                               java.lang.String lastUpdate)
        Returns the Json that comes from the API. Only for GET requests. Sets the If-Modified-Since header, although it does not bounce the http code 304.
        Parameters:
        restRequest - the API URI
        pName - an array with the names of the parameters, can be null
        pValue - an array with the values of the parameters, can be null
        lastUpdate - the date for the If-Modified-Since header in RFC 2822 format, may be null or empty
        Returns:
        the output Json, empty string if code 304 is returned
